title: Font matching trebuchet?
content:
Hi there.

I'm currently working on a corporate identity. The font in the logo is trebuchet.  
I'm looking for a matching font that can be used as display and text font.

sofar, i've managed to narrow it down to:  
- Sans  
- need lights up tp black  
- the font shouldn't be to 'masculin'

can anybody provide me with some tips?  
Thans a lot

Marco
author: Marco

comments.content:
I think I need a little more context. Can you tell me what the company is, and what they do? Do they prefer something more formal, like an insurance company or financing, or are they casual like a restaurant or a dotcommer?

-Andrew Welfle

Can't tell you a whole lot / understanding you need a context \> client is a (large) fashion retailer, target group women.

In proposals trebuchet was used, but i'm looking for something a little bit sleeker (thinner).

Thnx
Meta is pretty close to Trebuchet and is a nice typeface.

Trebuchet is very much an individual style. It is hard to match it up to another sanserif-style font. But if you are determined, try Gill Sans Light. It is of the artdeco style and might be what you are looking for. But, it only works mildly with Trebuchet Bold as long as it is of a smaller, lighter type size. It is not perfect, but works to some degree.

Personally, I would suggest a different type style for the fashion font. Two sans-like fonts don't always work well together. I would prefer a beutiful sans as the head, and a light, elegant serif as the tail.
